results.title: Sony Handycam DCR-SX65
results.brief_description: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 debuted in 1985 and while other models from the era have been discontinued, it’s been made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but camcorders like this have captured footage that has social and political ramifications.

constellations_primary.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_primary.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.description: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 is what it says: it’s a handy camera. Debuting on the market in 1985, its name came from its compact size that allowed it to fit in the user’s hand and capture their everyday lives more easily. While other models from this era have been discontinued, the Sony Handycam DCR-SX65’s popularity has seen it made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but their cost and convivence meant camcorders like this have been used to capture amateur footage that has social and political ramifications all around the world.
description_for_label: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 is what it says: it’s a handy camera. Debuting on the market in 1985, its name came from its compact size that allowed it to fit in the user’s hand and capture their everyday lives more easily. While other models from this era have been discontinued, the Sony Handycam DCR-SX65’s popularity has seen it made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but their cost and convivence meant camcorders like this have been used to capture amateur footage that has social and political ramifications all around the world.

results.title: Sony Digital Handycam DCR-VX1000
results.brief_description: Sony released the Handycam DCR-VX1000 in 1995, the same year digital video launched. It wasn’t just popular for amateurs and at-home users, but it was also deployed by professional news outlets looking to replace the large, expensive, shoulder mounted Betacam cameras.

constellations_primary.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_primary.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

results.description: Digital video was launched in 1995 and Sony released the Handycam DCR-VX1000 that same year. It was not only hugely popular for the amateur and at-home user, but it was also deployed by professional news outlets looking for something to replace the large, expensive, shoulder-mounted Betacam cameras. The camcorder was the answer, with high image quality matched by its affordability and portability. These same traits are what saw it became a seminal tool for the creation of skate cinema, with the Handycam DCR-VX1000 often paired with a fish-eye lens and used to record groundbreaking videos in the genre.
description_for_label: Digital video was launched in 1995 and Sony released the Handycam DCR-VX1000 that same year. results.title: Sony Betamovie BMC-100P
results.brief_description: This Sony Betamovie BMC-100P model of camera carried Betamax cassette tapes, which were introduced by Sony in 1975. It was the first consumer camcorder, including both camera and recorder in a single unit that would become standard in the years to follow.

constellations_primary.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_primary.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.

results.description: The late 1970s to 1980s were a time of voracious competition and innovation for companies attempting to gain a monopoly on the growing home video market. This Sony Betamovie BMC-100P model of camera carried Betamax cassette tapes, which were introduced by Sony in 1975. It was the first consumer camcorder, including both camera and recorder in a single unit that would become standard in the years to follow. The rival Betamax and VHS (Video Home System) formats were incompatible with each other, meaning buyers had to choose. The advantages of Betamax were its slightly superior picture quality and smaller size, but the length of recording time was considerably shorter than VHS.
description_for_label: The late 1970s to 1980s were a time of voracious competition and innovation for companies attempting to gain a monopoly on the growing home video market. This Sony Betamovie BMC-100P model of camera carried Betamax cassette tapes, which were introduced by Sony in 1975. It was the first consumer camcorder, including both camera and recorder in a single unit that would become standard in the years to follow. The rival Betamax and VHS (Video Home System) formats were incompatible with each other, meaning buyers had to choose. The advantages of Betamax were its slightly superior picture quality and smaller size, but the length of recording time was considerably shorter than VHS.

results.title: Sony Betacam BVP-3P
results.brief_description: Sony introduced the professional use Betacam cassette format in 1982 for the broadcast video industry. Although related to the Betamax format, its key differences were consumer orientated as it competed against VHS (Video Home System) in the videotape format wars of the period.

constellations_primary.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_primary.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

results.description: Electronic News Gathering – also known as ENG – is a term that emerged in the 1970s to describe news reporting that used electronic field production technology. ENG could refer to anything from a single camera operator to a production van transmitting from the field, as television departments moved to more immediate broadcast of news without having to wait for film to be developed. Sony introduced the professional use Betacam cassette format in 1982 for the broadcast video industry. Although related to the Betamax format, its key differences were consumer orientated as it competed against VHS (Video Home System) in the videotape format wars of the period. Interestingly Betacam continued to be used in a professional setting for much longer than Betamax lasted in the consumer market.
description_for_label: Electronic News Gathering – also known as ENG – is a term that emerged in the 1970s to describe news reporting that used electronic field production technology. ENG could refer to anything from a single camera operator to a production van transmitting from the field, as television departments moved to more immediate broadcast of news without having to wait for film to be developed. Sony introduced the professional use Betacam cassette format in 1982 for the broadcast video industry. Although related to the Betamax format, its key differences were consumer orientated as it competed against VHS (Video Home System) in the videotape format wars of the period. Interestingly Betacam continued to be used in a professional setting for much longer than Betamax lasted in the consumer market.

results.title: Sons of the Anzacs 1939-1945
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian War Memorial and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of the Australian forces in the principal campaigns of World War II, from the Middle East to New Guinea and the Pacific, with special reference to Tobruk and the Kokoda Trail. Includes archival footage and newsreels.

results.title: Sons of Namatjira (A)
results.creator_credit: Curtis Levy and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description: Keith Namatjira and his relatives paint in the style of his father, Albert and live in an artist’s camp set up by his father on the outskirts of Alice Springs. Highlights problems which the Namatjiras and Aborigines in general have to confront in their relationship with the world outside the community.

results.title: Sons of Matthew
results.creator_credit: Elsa Chauvel, Charles Chauvel and Expeditionary Films
results.brief_description: This is the story of three generations of the O’Riordan family, battling bushfire, drought and cyclone to settle rugged frontier land. Based on the true story of the O’Reilly family, it took two years to make this film in the wild mountain terrain of southeastern Queensland. In this film Charles Chauvel realises his romantic vision of Australians as spirited rural people conquering a hostile land. Its power lies in the strong performances of the cast and in the striking landscape, which frames the human and elemental conflicts.

results.title: Sons and lovers 'the dark forest' [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Terry Monagle and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Terry Monagle leads a discussion with a group of students in a program designed to aid understanding of the main characters of D H Lawrence’s novel in the context of the themes which concerned Lawrence in the writing of the novel.

results.title: Sono tornato
results.brief_description: Sono tornato (I’m Back) is a 2018 Italian satirical comedy film about Benito Mussolini directed by Luca Miniero, based on the German film Look Who’s Back, in turn based on the satirical novel of the same name.

constellations_other.name: Power and infamy
constellations_other.description: Beginning with an anamorphic image of Napoleon III, this Constellation focuses on representations of the distorted perspective of patriarchal power.
